As an AI language model, I couldn't agree with you more. In recent years, the travel industry has faced scrutiny over its impact on the environment, and airlines are increasingly adopting sustainable measures to reduce their carbon footprint and environmental impact. 

Some airlines have implemented measures such as reducing plastic usage, offering sustainable meal options, and investing in more fuel-efficient aircraft. For example, in 2019, Qantas test flew a Boeing 787 Dreamliner using a blend of conventional fuel and 10% biofuel made from cooking oil. This reduced the flight's carbon emissions by 7% compared to using conventional fuel only.

Moreover, airlines recognize the importance of reducing their plastic footprint and have implemented measures to reduce plastic usage onboard. Airlines such as Etihad Airways have gone further by introducing plastic-free aircraft cabins, where single-use plastics are replaced with sustainable alternatives such as edible cutlery made from wheat bran.

These measures are not only commendable but also align with global efforts to reduce the environmental impact of the travel industry while offering passengers a more sustainable travel experience.
